section.title: Introduction
section.para: Provide introduction to the different sources of uncertainty, the need to deal with it, and lead into different approaches that are relevant to rainfall-based estimation (uncertainty relevant to flood-data based methods are addressed in Book 3, Chapters 2 and 3).

section.title: Sources and types of uncertainty
section.para: Describe different sources of uncertainty relevant to flood estimation (data errors, sample size, non-stationarity, model uncertainty, parameter uncertainty), differentiate on basis of epistemic and aleatory sources.

section.title: Sensitivity Analysis
section.para: Describe use of sensitivity analysis and need for assessing impact on design outcome of interest. Possibly describe simplistic weighting of outcomes on estimated basis of likelihood.

section.title: Monte Carlo Analysis
section.para: Describe use of Monte Carlo analysis to assess impact of uncertainties arising from epistemic uncertainties. Discuss problems with identifying appropriate distributions and nature of dependencies.

section.title: Other techniques
section.para: Describe use of other mature techniques that are useful for assessing uncertainty in rainfall-runoff models.

section.title: Worked Example
section.para: Describe application of example technique to real-world modelling example relevant to flood estimation.
